summary: The debate over calculators in 1966 mirrors today's concerns about AI tools in education.  Learning the basics remains crucial, no matter the technology
title: A History of Protests

summary:
When 8BitDo announced they were selling a new keycap set that matched my keyboard I got from them I ordered immediately.  I didn't need new keycaps for it but I really wanted to get rid of that pesky windows key. 
They arrived this morning in nice little trays:

At lunch I swapped out a bunch of them including a lot of the ones with symbols on, along with the larger-text pgup/pgdown over on the right hand side...
title: Things I Like: 8BitDo Keycaps

summary: It's a beautiful sunny day out there, today.  I was going to go out for a walk this afternoon, camera in tow, to take photos of trees but.  I stepped out onto the balcony to check how cold it was because Siri said 4 degrees and...

summary:
A weekly list of interesting things I found on the internet, posted on Sundays when I can.  Sometimes themed, often not. 
It’s been a few weeks since I’ve gotten one of these out...

summary:
I heard that some hair salons in Sweden have started offering 'silent haircuts'.  When making the booking, you can request that you want the hairdresser to keep quiet during the haircut. 
My hairdresser isn't very talkative, so I don't even have to think about it...
title: Silent Cut

summary: For once, pop psychology gets it right.  We are doing the best we can do with what we have to work with

summary:
Carol Surface is out as the Chief People Officer at Apple.  It was less than two years ago when I commented on Chance Miller’s post about her joining the executive team:

I’m a bit surprised to see Apple hire an “outsider” for this high-profile role.  I thought they had learned their lesson last time...
title: Chief People Officer Left the Chat

summary: It's been a while that I don't post here, whoops.  I haven't done any tech projects lately (other than tinkering with CSS for my main blog), but I have been keeping afloat at work.  Without going into too much detail, I really need to think about what I want to do next after this gig is up, voluntarily or not...
title: Cybersecurity, Perhaps?
